title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.3: SOCIAL PROTECTION ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: Output 4.3: National Government and counties have increased capacity to formulate and implement child-centred social protection policies, legal and coordination frameworks, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4 - Social inclusion: An increased number of children from the poorest & most vulnerable households benefit from shock- responsive & integrated social protection interventions, as well as from child-specific policies

related-activity.ref: 2400/A0/06/004 OUTCOME 4: IMPROVED SOCIAL PROTECTION, INCLUSION & RESILIENCE BUILDING

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.3: National Government and counties have increased capacity to formulate and implement child-centred social protection policies, legal and coordination frameworks

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the Government of Kenya towards the design and implementation of a comprehensive Social Protection Policy and Legal Framework. UNICE also strengthened coordination forums at different levels to create an enabling environment that promotes inclusiveness, expansion and a systems approach towards Social Protection. Through tailored UNICEF advocacy measures, the sector is currently gearing towards the design and implementation of a universal child benefit in 2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of households benefitting from new or additional social assistance measures provided by governments to respond to COVID-19 with UNICEF support [COVIDSitRep]

Number of households benefitting from new or additional social assistance measures provided by governments to respond to COVID-19 with UNICEF support
2.3 Cash transfers: Existence of legislation on cash transfer programmes and/or family benefits
2.4 Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide
Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established in a selected number of counties
2.2 Policy/Strategy: Existence of valid national social protection strategy and/or policy
